subject: Re: [junit] junit.framework.TestCase.getName()(junit 3.8.x) equivalent in JUnit4.0 ??
msgSnippet: Vasudevan, Since test classes no longer have a common base class in JUnit 4, there s not a getName() method that you can call on test objects, as you ve
messageBody:
Vasudevan,

Since test classes no longer have a common base class in JUnit 4,
there's not a getName() method that you can call on test objects, as
you've noticed. Perhaps we can take a step backwards--what have you
been doing with the test name in JUnit 3.8? Perhaps there's an
equivalent strategy in JUnit 4 that doesn't require getName. Thanks,

David Saff

On 1/8/07, vkvasudevan <vkvasudevan@...> wrote:
> Hello,
> I have been using junit 3.8.x API, especially the TestCase.getName().
> This gives me , during runtime, the current test method name.
> Now, it time for me to migrate to Junit 4.0. Does any of you know what
> is the equivalent API call for getName() in 4.0?
> I have tried to use this as it is in 4.0, due to backward
> compatability , but a 'null' is returned. Subsequently, i have tried to
> with various Test runners available with 4.0 but only with
> OldTestClassRunner i get the correct information back. With the 4.0
> runner TestClassRunner i get 'null' always.
> Has any of you used the similar call getName() with junit 4.0 ? I there
> a similar method in Junit 4.0? or in its extension?
> Thanks and Regards
> Vasudevan
>
>
>
